markets.title: Will the **Senate pass a reconciliation bill** by July 4, 2022?
markets.subtitle: By July 4, 2022
markets.expiration_value: No such bill passed the Senate.
markets.rules_primary: If Congress.gov contains documentation of a bill that “passed Senate” between January 13, 2022 and || Date || and contains reconciliation instructions, then the market resolves to Yes.
markets.rules_secondary: It will expire the sooner of the first 10:00 AM following occurrence of the event, the first 10:00 AM following the release of data for || Date ||, or 10:00 AM one week after || Date ||.

markets.title: Will the Senate pass a reconciliation bill before January 10, 2022?
markets.subtitle: Before Jan 10, 2022
markets.expiration_value: No such eligible bill passed the Senate before January 10, 2022.
markets.rules_primary: If Congress.gov contains documentation of a bill that “passed Senate” between December 15, 2021 and || Date || and contains reconciliation instructions, then the market resolves to Yes.
markets.rules_secondary: It will expire the sooner of the first 10:00 AM following occurrence of the event, the first 10:00 AM following the release of data for || Date ||, or 10:00 AM one week after || Date ||.

markets.title: Will the Senate pass a **reconciliation bill** before December 25, 2021?
markets.subtitle: Before Dec 25, 2021
markets.rules_primary: If Congress.gov contains documentation of a bill that “passed Senate” between December 10, 2021 and || Date || and contains reconciliation instructions, then the market resolves to Yes.
markets.rules_secondary: It will expire the sooner of the first 10:00 AM following occurrence of the event, the first 10:00 AM following the release of data for || Date ||, or 10:00 AM one week after || Date ||.
